title: create-single-payment-plan

Payment plans created with this endpoint can exist independently and act as templates. Merchants also can associate a payment plan with a payment request to generate a customer payment plan. Use this endpoint to create a new single payment plan. 
## The request Create a single payment plan by sending a **POST** API request to the URI below. ### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api2.checkout.com/v2/recurringPayments/plans</p></pre> ### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/api2/v2/recurringPayments/plans</p></pre> ### Header parameters 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
`Content-Type` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`application/json` 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). ### Request example 
Shell Java
rename · delete

### Additional parameters 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`cycle ` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The elapsed time between the charge and the first transaction of the recurring plan. Maximum characters: 4. **Usage format: ** * Xd (X: 1 - 730 days) e.g. 7d * Xw (X: 1 - 104 weeks) e.g. 2w * Xm (X: 1 - 24 months) e.g. 1m * Xy (X: 1 - 2 years) e.g. 1y 
`name` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The name of the payment plan as displayed in The Hub and attached to the customer. Maximum characters: 100. 
`recurringCount` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The number of recurring transactions included in the Payment Plan. `recurringCount` does not include the initial payment. Maximum count varies based on the cycle: * If cycle = Xd, then max. recurringCount = (999*7) * If cycle = Xw, then max. recurringCount = 999 * If cycle = Xm, then max. recurringCount = 83 * If cycle = Xy, then max. recurringCount = 19 
`value` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The value of the payment as a non-zero positive integer (no decimals). <span class="table-info">[Find out more](doc:calculating-the-value)</span> 
`autoCapTime ` <span class="field-type">Decimal</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Set the delayed capture time in hours. Use values 0 to 168 (0 to 7 days). <span class="table-info">For more precise timings, use decimals: eg., 0.5 = 30 mins.</span> 
`currency` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Three-letter ISO currency code representing the currency of the payment. 
`planTrackId` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Unique identifier for the recurring plan set by the Merchant. Maximum characters: 50. 
--- ## The response If a payment plan response returns, then your request was successful. If you're having problems with this API, then ask our [support team](mailto:support@checkout.com) for help. Take a look at the example response below. ### Response example

Import from Gist
 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`paymentPlans` <span class="field-type">Array</span> 
The payment plan object. 
`totalCollectionCount` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> 
The total number of transactions that will be applied against the card. 
`totalCollectionValue` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> 
The total value of the transaction that will be applied against the card. 
 
Thanks for using Checkout.com. If you need any help or support, then message our support team at [support@checkout.com](mailto:support@checkout.com).
